sources.title: Cipher Bureau (1938) LEON AMES â™  JOAN WOODBURY
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars:  Leon Ames, Joan Woodbury, Don Dillaway, Charlotte Wynters
Director: Charles Lamont

The head of a government code-cracking unit has his hands full of trouble. When he lists his brother to go undercover and infiltrate an Axis espionage ring, the young naval officer falls under the spell of a beautiful Mata Hari.

sources.title: Cipher Bureau (1938) Leon Ames, Charlotte Wynters, Joan Woodbury (Crime, Action) Movie
sources.description:
Intrigue, deception, and the ultimate code to freedom.
The younger brother of an officer in a secret government code-breaking unit gets involved with a gang of spies and a beautiful double agent.

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/wENhvXlac2U


Original title: Cipher Bureau (1938)
This film is subtitled in many languages.

Director: Charles Lamont
Writers: Arthur Hoerl, Monroe Shaff 
Stars: Leon Ames, Charlotte Wynters, Joan Woodbury|
Genres: Action, Adventure, Crime, Drama, Romance


00:00 Full Movie (with subtitles)
01:50 Government agents decode a mysterious message, leading to a hunt for criminals using cipher codes.
08:01 Government agents track mysterious radio signals to Capitol building, fearing threat to American lives.
16:51 Deciphering a complex code to uncover a spy ring involving multiple locations and suspects.
24:13 Deciphering a secret message about stolen naval plans and a covert operation involving various characters.
34:23 Investigation into espionage involving a military officer and alien spies.
38:28 A story of betrayal, innocence, and espionage unfolds as characters navigate through deceit and uncover hidden truths.
48:10 A tale of love, betrayal, and espionage unfolds as a woman tries to prove her loyalty to her lover amidst a dangerous mission.
55:30 A mysterious message leads to a race against time to decode a hidden secret involving a pianist and stolen naval plans.
1:04:25 Undercover agents uncover a plot involving a cipher, a seaplane, and federal agents aboard a ship.


@CultCinemaClassics
